channel.title: 0xOpenBytes
channel.description: OpenBytes is a small group of passionate open source developers who come together to collaborate on projects and share their knowledge.

item.title: Adapt and Overcome!
item.description: Adapters make it easy for us to transform and mold network models into client models.

item.description: A barebones no frills introduction to displaying the most basic of charts, a BarÂ Chart.

item.title: Eliminating Duplicates in Arrays
item.description: While working with arrays, you may be tasked in making sure said array does not have any duplicates. We'll cover a few various methods to complete that within this article.

item.description: Introduction into the use of ScreenData in 2021.

item.title: Koltin infix Notation
item.description: Koltin infix keyword allows for calling without parenthesis.

item.title: Improving UX Using ProgressView
item.description: Your users experience is important, and it's better to show something than nothing. Using SwiftUI ProgressView does just that.

item.title: Reduce and Fold
item.description: An introduction to Kotlin's `reduce` and `fold` functions, along with some use cases.

item.title: SwiftLet 01: Variables
item.description: SwiftLet #01: Variables! In this article we dive into variables and their various (pun intended) usecases.

item.title: SwiftLet 02 - Let
item.description: Let us learn more about the let in this episode of SwiftLet!

item.title: SwiftLet 03: The var Variable
item.description: Variables are used in every single Swift project and are important things! They do a variety of work for us so take a peek and learn all about them.

item.title: SwiftLet 04: Optionals
item.description: What if a variable doesn't always need to have a variable? Well, that means it's an optional!

item.title: SwiftLet 05: Closures
item.description: A Closure is a block of code that can be executed by reference of a variable or name. Jump in and learn more about closures and how they can be used.
